attributes.comment:
I am against the fee increase for fingerprints and filing I-600 and I-600A appoption
petitions for several reasons.

I am currently in the process to adopt from China. The wait period for China is
currently 15-18 months. This is almost a guarantee that I will have to refile my
application and fingerprints and thus pay twice what I should have to anyway.

The fact that fingerprints expire after 15 months when the application is valid for 18
months is also redicilous.

I work as a police officer for a municipal agency. The fact that fingerprints expire
at all is also a strange to me. If the fingerprints were taken and are made to
expire at the time of the application for adoption, the system could rerun them if
needed if there is a re-application. Why reprint?

Please don't increase the fees. Also, please lengethen the I-171H to 24 months
as this would eleviate much stress and financial hardship for many of us.

Thanks, Rex Steele

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Rexford J. Steele
